XORP Source Downloads

As of July 2004, the architecture is basically complete and it might be used as the basis for research. The software is reasonably stable and can be used for routing, but there are known issues. See the current status of the different parts of XORP, or the release notes for information about changes between releases.

Please note that to build all the XORP modules and test programs with debugging enabled, you will need nearly 1GB of free disk space. XORP is written in C++, and has been mainly developed on FreeBSD 4.x. The current release 1.0 is known to compile with gcc 2.95.x, 2.96, 3.3.4, and 3.4.0 (prerelease).

The code should build and run on Linux 2.4.x, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, and NetBSD.

Latest Release

The latest source code version is the release 1.0. If you have problems downloading, try a mirror site.
